From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the number of data bits per character that are generated and interpreted by Cisco software to either 7 bits or 8 bits, use the **default-value data-character-bits** command in global configuration mode. To disable the configured size, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Selects 7 bits as the default size.
Selects 8 bits as the default size.

Examples: The following example shows how to set the default number of data character bits to 8:

RelatedCmds.description: Defines the EXEC character width to either 7 bits or 8 bits.
Configures the default frequency time to scan modem signals.
Configures the flow control default value from a 7-bit width to an 8-bit width.
